intro: [WRONG START] Psidium bahorucano, commonly known as the Madagascar guava. It is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family, native to Madagascar. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, requiring well-drained soil and ample sunlight. Its botanical features include simple, opposite leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom throughout the year.
